It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, peppers, and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, and they are edible but often have a mild, bitter taste. Carludovica helicotricha is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils at higher elevations.
